install.description: This tastefully, but highly modified Twin Turbo 997 showcases one of the most efficient high performance sound systems, the way we like to do them.
With its aggressive looks and incredible performance, the sound system had to be as light, unobtrusive and factory looking as possible.

A JL Audio subwoofer now resides in the passenger footwell occupying the space of the original Bose sub, plus only a couple of extra inches of foot space. It was covered in OEM terra cotta carpet for a seamless integration.
The Porsche radio (PCM) was retained as the source. But a NAV-TV iPod module was interfaced to the fiber optic MOST bus system, which allows complete control of the iPod.
A recessed bass knob that controls the Genesis amp was tucked into the pocket in front of the shifter.

The Genesis Profile Four Ultra amplifier was flush mounted in the very front of the trunk. At a little over an inch thick we lost some space, but gained a lot by removing the factory CD changer and making a new floor.
The reason for the L-shaped box is to cover the hole left in the carpet by the Bose woofer. We re-used the original floor vent / power outlet to make it look OEM.
A JL Audio 8W3V2 woofer was used with the extended pole piece (magnet) sealing air-tight to the outside of the box. This allowed us to make the box as thin as possible.
A pair of Focal K2P Power 6.5in component speakers was installed in the factory door locations along with Dynamat sound deadening.

You can get pretty much any option you want when you buy a Porsche, except for a yellow chrono display (the lap-counter in the middle of the dash) to match the yellow gauges. We sourced one from TechArt in Germany and made the customer very happy.
Putting the little sucker in was a bit tricky.
A Fabspeed exhaust and intake system along with a serious ECU upgrade make this Porsche scream with close to 600HP.
Here you see the Dynamat sound deadening applied to the inner door skin as well as the sub box under construction.
